detaileddescription.para: SIGCHLD signal management routine, for detecting the end of a child process
The 'main' function as in every C program.

simplesect.para: status to calling program by calling the exit(3C) function.

memberdef.name: usage
memberdef.initializer:
"Usage: %s [-hd][-L <logfile>][-N <dbg_lvl>][-f <config_file>]
" "	[-h] display this help
" "	[-L <logfile>] set the default logfile for the daemon
" "	[-N <dbg_lvl>] set the verbosity level
" "	[-f <config_file>] set the config file to be used
" "	[-d] the daemon starts in background, in a new process group
" "	[-R] daemon will manage RPCSEC_GSS (default is no RPCSEC_GSS)
" "	[-F] <nb_flushers> flushes the data cache with purge, but do not answer to requests
" "	[-S] <nb_flushers> flushes the data cache without purge, but do not answer to requests
" "----------------- Signals ----------------
" "SIGUSR1 : Enable/Disable File Content Cache forced flush
" "------------- Default Values -------------
" "LogFile : /tmp/ganesha_nfsd.log
" "DebugLevel : NIV_EVENT
" "ConfigFile : /etc/ganesha_nfsd.conf
"

briefdescription.para: The file that contain the 'main' routine for the nfsd.

detaileddescription.para:
Author
deniel
nfs_main.c : The file that contain the 'main' routine for the nfsd.
